column1: Interview Questions
Goal; Complete your dating profile
Targets / Questions:

On a scale of 1-5... how much did you enjoy the HumorMe onboarding process? (1 being "I did not enjoy it at all", 5 being "I enjoyed it a lot")
Please expand.
column3: Process is easy, idea is different, possibility to match with different people you normally wouldn't match with.
column5: I liked picking memes and what makes me laugh and the comedians. I don't know about the Fuck, Marry, Kill because it doesn't seem necessary. The prompts don't seem necessary so would like it to be optional
column7: It's very different from other dating apps. Most just make you put in the same information so these features are new and have a lot of potential. I wish every option would be optional so I didn't have to answer all of them like religion or favorite comedian
column9: *Prefer not to say on religious beliefs* Would like to upload my own memes - maybe upload your own memes when you upload pictures? I liked the onboarding process, pretty easy. Liked the amount of options, don't want too many options. Diversity in memes are bad ("Facebook mom memes")

column1:
On a scale of 1-5... how easy was it to achieve the goal of creating your dating profile? (1 being "very difficult", 5 being "super easy")
Please expand.
column3: Good amount of questions to ask someone without getting too personal, gives you an idea of who you are without asking uncomfortable questions
column5: Quick and simple, very easy to follow
column7: Seemed pretty similar to other apps, didn't ask too much but just enough to get a good sense of people you want to date
column9: Very easy granted I didn't have to think about anything, promopts are stressful because I have to choose what I think will give me the most matches. Liked that I could just use my instagram pictures and options for shows/comedians

column1:
On a scale of 1-5... how accurately did the questions/answers reflect your sense of humor? (1 being "not accurately at all", 5 being "very accurately")
FU: Was there any information you felt was particularly relevant? Irrelevant?
column3: I don't feel like I am a super funny person but I feel like I answered enough to get an idea of my personality and what I like. I feel like some people wouldn't enjoy some of the questions because some of the memes were outdated and some people may not like the TV shows
column5: The memes that autopopulated were bland and old, I wish I could upload my own memes
column7: I'm a super funny person so I wish I could have uploaded my own memes! It seems like I was forced to choose the funniest option out of many bad jokes
column9: TV shows & comedians & prompts show my personality but wish it was more customizable. Would prefer to upload up to 6 of my own memes because it shows MY personality.

column1:
On a scale of 1-5... how helpful were the prompts to building your dating profile? (1 being "not helpful at all", 5 being "very helpful")
Please expand.
column3: Prompts add personality and helped set up my dating profile, good amount of questions
column5: Very helpful, instructions were clear and I knew where to go and how I was supposed to answer
column7: I wish there were more about your interests instead of just about memes. I understand wanting to find someone funny but it doesn't matter if someone is funny but is the complete opposite person from you with other views.
column9: "Feels like a buzzfeed quiz", prompts allow you to show your personality with the custom text box WANT: link a youtube, vine, or tiktok clip on my profile that describes me

column1: Preview profile
Goal; Match with someone
column3: I like that there is a timeline and being able to see all

column1: Targets / Questions:
Is it clear what the 'Heart' and 'X' do?
column3: Yes, very clear, very similar to Tinder/Bumble
column5: Yes, very clear
column7: Yep! Made sense- just like Tinder even though I've never used Tinder
column9: Yep, worldwide knowledge in the dating world what the heart and x do

column1:
On a scale of 1-5... how do you feel about this method of browsing potential dates (scroll instead of queue)? (1 being "I did not enjoy it at all", 5 being "I enjoyed it a lot")
Please expand.
column3: I prefer this better than the swiping layout because it gives you more options and makes me more inclined to go to someone's profile and learn more about them
column5: I like this better than other apps because it gives me more options and I can compare the guys side by side instead of only focusing on one guy at a time. Seems more efficient and saves time.
column7: Seems interesting but I feel like I wouldn't ever use the X and instead I would just like whoever I find attractive and skip over people I don't like. Does the timeline update every time? Or do the same people stay on the timeline until you X them?
column9: Gives me a comparison of what's out there and let's me go back to other people in case you accidentally press the X

column1:
On a scale of 1-5... how helpful do you feel this browsing experience will be in finding a match? (1 being "not helpful at all", 5 being "very helpful")
Please expand.
column3: If there are enough people on the app, I think this would be great to showing you more options and shows more possibilities are out there for me than the single person in front of me like on Tinder
column5: More helpful because you can see more people. Is it an infinite list or does it shuffle every time you X or heart someone? I prefer this over the swiping experience. Also depends how many people are on the app, would be boring if there are not a lot of options
column7: It doesn't really matter to me. At the end of the day you are still doing the same thing of X'ing them or hearting them. Would hate to keep seeing the same people. I like that you can leave people and come back to them if you are indifferent about them though!
column9: Nice to see the smilarities and I really like being able to compare all of my choices and saves me time in having to swipe through every person

column1:
On a scale of 1-5... how prominent is the humor theme during the browsing process? (1 being "not prominent at all", 5 being "very prominent")
Please expand.
column3: Would have to go back and look more deeply (so I take this that the user did not get enough exposure to the humor aspects)
column5: Good amount, wish people had to make their own catch phrases or jokes so you could see how funny they REALLY are
column7: There are only three things: Name, job, and a joke, so yeah pretty prominent
column9: I like that it shows a sneak preview and encourages me to go to their profile to explore more, but I like more at pictures first. Attractiveness comes first and humor comes second for me personally

column1: Icebreak
Goal; Schedule a live date
Targets / Questions:

In terms of fun how would you rate the Icebreak challenge? (1 being "not fun at all", 5 being "very fun")
Please expand.
column3: It's different and less awkward because you don't have to start the conversation yourself
column5: Something different, better than just guys sending you cheesy pickup lines or sliding into your DMs
column7: Good conversation starter, want to send my own memes
column9: If I thought I could have a good conversation with them I would prefer to talk to them but I liked having a conversation starter

column1: How did feel about the chat being locked until you complete the Icebreak challenge?
column3: I think it's fine I didn't mind, I think it's a good way to get to know someone before starting the actual chat, maybe more questions or different prompts
column5: I don't care either way, having both options would be better.
column7: Good because you can't get unsolicited messages or d*ck pics
column9: I liked it because it makes you start a conversation instead of just matching with someone and never actually talking

column1:
On a scale of 1-5... how likely would you be to schedule a live date through the app? (1 being "not likely at all", 5 being 'very likely')
Please expand.
column3: I wouldn't do a live chat right away but maybe after chatting for a while and getting to know the person better
column5: Would never do that.... ever. Too antisocial and shy.
column7: I don't even facetime people so videochatting is just weird for me. Cool feature though
column9: Especially during Covid I would use this before meeting someone in person. Also a great feature for girls who are nervous a guy might be creepy and they don't want to meet them in person yet

column1: Likelihood of scheduling private live date
column3: More likely

column1: Likelihood of scheduling invite-only live date
column3: Less likely
column9: 4 - would be fun to have my friends "vet" guys with me and make sure they are normal

column1: Likelihood of scheduling public live date
column3: Not likely at all
column9: 1 - I'm not that outgoing and would probably embarass myself. I know people would use this though and think it could be funny like reality tv

column1: FU: If all ranked 0, ask what, if anything, would convince them use those features.
column3: Not in my comfort zone, maybe after we knew each other more
column7: I would do it more if people weren't able to say random things in chat or make fun of you

column1: Live date (Dater view)
Goal; Navigate to live date
Targets / Questions:
On a scale of 1-5... how do you feel about audience sending prompts? (1 being "I don't like it", 5 being "I think it's very fun")
column3: I think that's awesome and I think it's super fun to have the audience controlling the conversation
column5: Would rather have people send prompts than just random chat for people to talk about us on our first date, could introduce bullying
column7: I like the prompts and think it would be funny if there were some 18+ questions to make jokes about with the other person
column9: I think it's really fun, especially if both people are into being live so would be entertaining watch, keeps the conversation going

column1: On a scale of 1-5... Do you feel rating your date adds value to this experience? (1 being "It adds no value", 5 being "It adds a lot of value")
column3: I don't think we really need to rate our dates but maybe if it was a private option
column5: No I don't want to know how people rated me, maybe if there was some benefit to your profile or it showed on your profile how many stars you have
column7: Not really... I would hate to think I was having a good talk with a girl just to get off and she rates me a one star?
column9: I would want to see if I was good and let guys know if they were funny but it would suck to get a bad rating. Maybe if it worked as an algorithm and helped find me better dates

column1: Live date (spectator view)
Goal; Understand how live dates work
Targets / Questions:

On a scale of 1-5... how likely would you be to watch live dates through HumorMe? (1 being "not likely at all", 5 being 'very likely') 
Please expand.
column3: I would love to watch other people go on live dates, would be super fun
column5: Think it would be interesting, I would just hate to have people watch me. Reminds me of reality tv
column7: I would never waste my time watching other people, I would only do it if my friend was on a date so I could mess around with them
column9: Reminds me of the bachelor, super cool idea

column1:
On a scale of 1-5... how do you feel about HumorMe's system for interacting with live prompts (i.e. nice, naughty and normal prompts)? (1 being "I don't like them at all", 5 being 'I like them a lot') 
Please expand.
column3: I think they are really fun, and add a little more flavor and makes it unique to other apps
column5: I like having categories of questions to pick from
column7: Seems like the only way, I wouldn't change them
column9: You can learn a lot from the prompts and how they answer the questions instead of having to ask your own questions,

column1:
On a scale of 1-5... having seen the live dates section, how likely woud you be to go on a public live date using the HumorMe app?  (1 being "not likely at all", 5 being 'very likely') 
Please expand.
column3: Unlikely, my personality is just awkward and I wouldn't do it but I think other people would use it
column9: Depends on the people and how many people are in the audience, would prefer if you could choose different locations

column1: On a scale of 1-5...how important do you feel flagging content is for live dates?
column5: 5, very important
column7: 5 - Don't want underage people seeing nudity or bullying to happen on live dates
column9: 5, prevents yelling or hyper-sexual conversations so the audience is uncomfortable

column1: Profile tab
Goal: Find key information easily
Targets / Questions:
On a scale of 1-5... how accurately are you able to express yourself to potential daters on this app with this profile format? (1 being "not accurately at all", 5 being "very accurately")
column3: Wish the app had a brief bio, like prefernces for things, memes are fun but it's also a dating app that needs more personal questions
column5: Don't have any spots for actual personal information, I like the funny stuff but that seems to be the only info on the entire profile, this is a dating app so I want to know other interests besides what makes them laugh
column7: I want to know more about girls besides the shows or memes they like so would like more questions about who they are and what other things they like
column9: Pretty accurate, like the layout - seems pretty similar to all other dating apps

column1: What (if anything) would you want to add here?
column3: No
column5: I want to know people's political stance in today's age, not just the jokes guys make
column7: Hobbies, interests, NEEDS a section for vines
column9: Need a bio to tell people what I'm looking for or at least the option to

column1: What (if anything) would you want to remove?
column3: No
column7: 6 is a good amount of pictures, don't want more than that to scroll through
column9: Nothing

column1: Close out questions

On a scale of 1-5... how likely would you be to use this app? (1 being "not likely at all", 5 being "extremely likely)
Please expand.
column3: It's a cool new idea that woulds attract more people my age, very unique
column5: I like the social side of the app that we've never seen on dating apps before, I also like that you can meet with someone via live chat instead of meeting in person because for girls that can be very scary to meet guys in person
column7: Only if the finished product has more than just funny stuff, need to know more about other people
column9: Would be a 3 if I was in a bigger city with a more diverse pool of users to choose from

column1:
On a scale of 1-10... how likely would you be to recommend this app to a friend? (1 being "not likely at all", 10 being "extremely likely)
Please expand.
column3: I would love my friends to be on the app and the feeling of being social instead of just another dating app, much better for my generation, adds more fun to dating
column5: I would send this to my single friends 100% so I could watch their dates
column7: Only say 8 because I don't have any experience with other dating apps but I know my friend group woould like this
column9: If I was using it, I would want my friends to be on it too. This would be something my friends would use to watch dates and watch each other's dates
